item.title: Comment on Geoscience to Data Science Starter Pack by Justin
item.dc:creator: Justin

item.title: Comment on Geoscience to Data Science Starter Pack by Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description: Thank for the update, Justin! I've wandered off into GIS Analyst territory, and while it's nice (I get to go outside and map gas infrastructure), I miss using a terminal window and debugging scripts to get things done. Taking another look, and I headed back to your site for a refresh on our 2015 discussions... so I appreciate you keeping this fresh.
item.content:encoded: Thank for the update, Justin! I’ve wandered off into GIS Analyst territory, and while it’s nice (I get to go outside and map gas infrastructure), I miss using a terminal window and debugging scripts to get things done. Taking another look, and I headed back to your site for a refresh on our 2015 discussions… so I appreciate you keeping this fresh.

item.description:
In reply to <a href="/raspberry-shake-personal-seismometer/#comment-110">Branden Christensen</a>.
Branden,
Yes, feel free to re-post the photos on your instagram account, absolutely.
Justin www.justingosses.com
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Branden Christensen.

Branden,

Yes, feel free to re-post the photos on your instagram account, absolutely.

Justin
http://www.justingosses.com/

item.title: Comment on Raspberry Shake – Personal Seismometer by Branden Christensen
item.dc:creator: Branden Christensen
item.description:
Justin:
Awesome post! Thanks for the kind words and your support as a Kickstarter backer. Everyone here on the Raspberry Shake team is working hard to make Raspberry Shake as good as possible. And this kind of feedback fuels the fire.
I would love to re-post your photos on our Instagram page at @raspberryshake (https://www.instagram.com/raspberryshake/). Cool if I do that?
Yours, Branden Christensen Director of the Raspberry Shake Project #raspberryshake
item.content:encoded:
Justin:

Awesome post! Thanks for the kind words and your support as a Kickstarter backer. Everyone here on the Raspberry Shake team is working hard to make Raspberry Shake as good as possible. And this kind of feedback fuels the fire.

I would love to re-post your photos on our Instagram page at @raspberryshake (https://www.instagram.com/raspberryshake/). Cool if I do that?

Yours, Branden Christensen
Director of the Raspberry Shake Project
#raspberryshake

item.title: Comment on Nodebots by Nolan
item.dc:creator: Nolan
item.description:
Really interesting to get an attendee's perspective on the event Justin - great write-up!
I've gone ahead and added a link to this post in our recap of the day's events ( https://nodejshouston.github.io/bots/ ), along with some photos and video.
item.content:encoded:
Really interesting to get an attendee’s perspective on the event Justin – great write-up!

I’ve gone ahead and added a link to this post in our recap of the day’s events ( https://nodejshouston.github.io/bots/ ), along with some photos and video.

item.title: Comment on Nodebots by Kelsey
item.dc:creator: Kelsey
item.description: Great blog post, glad to hear it went so well! Quick link fix, though, please: the Tessel getting started instructions you have linked right now point to Tessel 1 instructions; T2 instructions are at tessel.io/start. Can be very frustrating for folks trying to get started with T2 who don't realize they're working with the wrong instruction set. :) Kelsey
item.content:encoded: Great blog post, glad to hear it went so well! Quick link fix, though, please: the Tessel getting started instructions you have linked right now point to Tessel 1 instructions; T2 instructions are at tessel.io/start. Can be very frustrating for folks trying to get started with T2 who don’t realize they’re working with the wrong instruction set. ðŸ™‚ Kelsey
